Today we see the biggest restriction on freedom of expression in the United States since may the McCarthy era may ever Looking back NUM was the golden age of the fight against disinformation but today there no longer even agreement that fake news dangerous to democracy says disinformation researcher Nina Jankowicz in our interview 

 Nina Jankowicz briefly headed the Biden administration's anti-disinformation body in NUM but resigned due to wave of massive online harassment against her In her two published books she examines the relationship between technology and democracy the impact of Russian disinformation on Western societies and online violence agains wom She currently works primarily in the civil and academic spheres to combat disinformation We spoke with her at conference in Chisinau about the online attacks against her the Trump administration's peculiar interpretation of free speech the responsibility of social media platforms and what we should do to create healthier online environment 

 Here are her key statements 

 The disinformation environment has become much noisier over the pas decade platforms have yielded to political pressure and there are more and more target smear campaigns domestic disinformation and misleading information generated by AI. 

 Disinformation has become normalized the spread of misleading information even appearing at the highest levels of certain governments 

 Platforms do not even follow their own rules and have financial interest in spreading disinformation 

 Stopping paid political advertising not good idea and it restricts freedom of speech 

 We need to move towards more active information consumption where we choose more consciously what content we click on 

 Nina Jankowicz at the Unveil the Truth Conference in Chisinau november NUM NUM 

 In NUM you were appointed to lead the Biden administration Disinformation Governance Board and you were immediately target by massive online harassment You were called the minister of truth the disinformation czarina you were target with deepfake porn Could you tell me more about your experience around that time 

 I joined March 2nd of NUM just week after the full-scale invasion of Ukraine The Disinformation Governance Board was an advisory board of the United States Department of Homeland Security DHS The board was supposed to bring together various parts of the DHS that dealt with disinformation and ensure that these were harmonized in the fight against disinformation My job was to make sure that the policies they were using to respond to disinformation were protecting civil rights privacy and freedom of expression The board never intended to censor anything or remove any information from the internet it had no right to do so and I had no decision-making authority I merely issued policy recommendations for them to implement 

 The Biden administration only announced my appointment eight weeks after I started work which was mistake in such sensitive political issue Not only did the announcement come late but it was also not very transparent it raised more questions than it answered The right-wing saw narrative in it they could control 

 They said that I will censoring people Tucker Carlson said that I will have the power to send men with guns to the homes of Americans with whom I disagree Very quickly not only was I the lead story on almost every Fox News segment but constant harassment was directed towards me and my family 

 I was pregnant that time with my first and still only child and it was my first government job I wanted to speak out and defend myself but the department said that I was under embargo They also didn t respond to media requests They thought it would blow over But it didn t. Three weeks later it was still happening threats against me and my family were pretty significant we were doxed people were saying terrible things about my unborn child In the meantime the administration didn t protect me I left because I felt that there was chance that if I left the government my family would left alone it didn t seem worth sticking around an administration which did not seem to have my back 

 Nina Jankowicz graduated from Bryn Mawr College in Pennsylvania with degree in Russian and Political Science in NUM as Fulbright scholar she assisted the Ukrainian Ministry of Foreign Affairs in its anti-disinformation and strategic communications work Later as fellow at the Wilson Center Washington-based think tank she researched the relationship between democracy and technology In NUM Times magazine named her one of the NUM influential people in the field of artificial intelligence In her book How to Lose the Information War NUM she analyzed Western democracies responses to Russian propaganda while in How to Woman Online NUM she examined the phenomenon of digital harassment against women In NUM she founded the American Sunlight Project where she continues her research on modern democracies and disinformation 

 What happened after did the harassment really blow over 

 Not at all the threats continued very strongly Fox News continued to talk about me almost every week for the rest of NUM they depicted me as woke and feminazi 

 The coverage of me and my appointment was totally disproportionate to the actual power that I had in my position 

 Later I decided to sue Fox News after long process in September NUM it was announced that I lost the defamation lawsuit The reasoning included that people understood Fox News coverage as an opinion and not fact which crazy because people don t threaten other people if they think it just an opinion The famous Supreme Court case New York Times versus Sullivan was also cited which says that you can criticise the government I have problem with that because the criticism of the government was not just about the government but it was about me They had my picture they used my ne they made fun of me one guy even asked how could you put pregnant person to job like this It was clearly very personal Threats are continuing until this very day I deal with cyber stalker who still harassing me and my family 

 My case can very discouraging for people who want to pursue public service because essentially it says that if you re serving the government it open season on your life and there nothing you can do about it This will result in fewer people especially fewer women and fewer minorities entering public service 

 Fotó EU DisinfoLab Sandi Fišer 

 You ve been working as disinformation expert for quite some time It has been almost NUM years since Trump took office in NUM What has changed since then in the disinformation landscape 

 Over the last year and half the platforms are really holding back from content moderation that they used to do from the investments they were making in order to push back on disinformation and that because of the political pressure from the Trump administration Trump has gone so far as to say that he wanted to see Mark Zuckerberg jailed for the rest of his life lawsuits were filed against the platforms but since Trump took office again the cases have been settle The CEOs of the platforms showed up in his inauguration sitting even in front of his cabinet They ve given lot of money to his inaugural committee and they also changed the policies to the point where they ve reinstated some of the worst disinformers and abusers on platforms particularly on 00. 

 How foreign actors behave on platforms has also changed they don t have to hide as much as they used to because platforms don t care if there massive trolling bad campaigns coordinated abuse or inauthentic behaviour campaigns happening on their site Russia China and Iran are doing this Thirdly the normalization of domestic disinformation massive There was always domestic disinformation but that was always rather behind the curtain people had to quieter about it Now you see the entire Republican party doing it sometimes the Democrats 

 But it coming from domestic political parties all over the world including Fidesz in Hungary Law and Justice in Poland Ivanishvili regime in Georgia 

 The disinformation landscape seems much noisier And then you ad AI into this mix it much easier to create and disseminate disinformation I look back at NUM as golden age of fighting disinformation because we had cross-party consensus that it was bad and we have to do something about it We don t have that anymore 

 One of Donald Trump first actions upon taking office again earlier this year was to sign the so-called Restoring Free Speech executive order which refers to the Biden administration's efforts to combat disinformation as censorship in its introduction What happening under the restoring freedom of speech banner 

 Over the pas NUM months we ve seen the biggest restrictions on freedom of expression in the United States since may the McCarthy era may ever 

 The accusation of censorship against researchers civil society organizations and platforms meant to quash dissent and silence people Every institution we had that worked on the field of disinformation has been obliterated because the administration didn t like what they were doing in shining light on the way Russian or other foreign narratives had converged with the right-wing narratives Ultimately this hanging on to power 

 You said in an interview recently that under the Trump administration there will no combatting disinformation only embracing it What does that mean for society 

 When disinformation and I think this reflects the situation in Hungary lifted up to the highest levels of government and comes out of the commander in chief mouth being doubled down on by everyone else around him you really start to question reality and it hard not to gaslight yourself So many people who don t engage with the news every day who don t understand how the infrastructure of the internet works they re just not prepared to deal with this onslaught 

 Disinformation has become normalized if nobody pushes back on it or if those who push back are demonized and made out to treasonous individuals then the possibility of communication truly ceases to exis 

 That why we must keep working we need to show that we cannot silenced We are all striving toward the same goal of preserving our democracy and our shared reality that one of the reasons I continue to speak out despite everything my family went through because if I went to work on something else or just wen back working solely on Ukraine I would just accept this situation 

 And like your readers in Hungary I know what happens when democracy undermined not just from my work in Russia Ukraine and Belarus but also from my family personal history 

 My grandfather at the age of NUM with his entire family was sent to work camp in Siberia and then came to the US in search of the American dream as refugee Americans don t have that reference point and if I can remind them of it I will continue to emphasize it 

 What or what should the role of the platforms in combating disinformation 

 In an ideal world at least platforms are enforcing their own rules unfortunately platforms walked away from their own rules That means their responsibility according to US law very little they must take down terroris content and child sexual abuse material We passed the Take It Down act which deals with deepfake pornography and says that deepfake sexual abuse materials have to taken down within NUM hours This something I am glad for as it such big problem affecting millions of women who didn t have any rights to civil or criminal action But other than that there no pressure on the platforms to do anything The platforms have no responsibility I think they should doing lot more they have terms and conditions they abide by but nobody pushing them to do that 

 And money plays role in this too In early november Reuters investigation revealed that Meta projected last year that 10% of its overall annual revenue would come from running advertising for scams 

 Platforms have monetary interest in continuing to spread disinformation because the enraging content online the engaging one That means they benefit when people are hooked up on their platforms and people are mad and scrolling and interacting and clicking on ads 

 Now that the government not putting pressure on them they have no interest in maintaining public sphere that truthful grounded in reality and respectful The EU the last hope in that and unfortunately the Digital Services Act DSA under fire right now 

 Having said that from October NUM Meta and Google have in theory stopped running political paid ads within the European Union claiming that EU transparency regulations on political advertising place too great burden on them Meanwhile in Hungary political advertisers are trying to find loopholes to circumvent the system Do you think it good idea to stop these ads in general 

 no I don t think it lot of disinformation goes through organic amplification anyway they don t have to pay for it The other reason why I think it bad to cut off paid political ads that that one of the only ways that smaller parties or candidates have connected with voters and it disadvantages those smaller parties more than the big ones I think it restriction on free speech 

 Nina Jankowicz at the Unveil the Truth Conference in Chisinau november NUM NUM 

 We ve talked lot about problems let talk about the viable solutions now You ve mentioned regulations Europe DSA but are they enough for cleaner and healthier online environment 

 The regulation part of it The platforms need to held accountable for the duty of care of their users for violent content or contents containing disinformation Researchers and journalists need access to data Facebook ad library part of it but they shut down Crowdtangle this program showed up-to-date data on content found on Facebook and its dissemination so it lot more difficult to study Facebook now I don t think that governments should investigating disinformation the way civil society can It better for somebody else to say things so then governments can act based on those investigations But we need access to do that 

 More broadly though we need to educate people information literacy really important People need to understand how platforms work what their interests are We should explain that if you search for pair of shoes on Monday and keep getting ads on Instagram from Tuesday to Friday here why and her what you can do to resist it 

 We ve gotten to point where so much of the information consumption we do passive 

 If we can make everybody little more active in information consumption deliberately choosing what to look at click on or share we would in better place 

 Cover photo EU DisinfoLab Sandi Fišer

 további tévépiaci hír

Young attractive fans of football Orbán and relationship drama inside the sophisticated pro-Fidesz fake-profile network on Facebook We identified network of nearly one hundred Facebook profiles whose members live in an AI generated reality and systematically spread content that supports the governing party 

 Cintia and Zoltán announced on Facebook in early november that they were seeing each other The news spread quickly among their friends of whom welcomed the announcement and wished the couple happiness and in some cases children But there were few who took offense at learning about the new relationship through social media Zoltán also revealed that he had grown close not only to Cintia but to her family as well Beneath the announcement he posted photo of Cintia younger sister Kiara taken outside Puskás Aréna where she was indulging their shared passion for soccer 

 My girlfriend sister Kiara in front of Puskás last July forrás Facebook 

 few days later came the shock In another public Facebook comment Zoltán wrote that Cintia had not been entirely hones with him While they were together she also had an affair with another friend of theirs Benedek Their relationship ended quickly Cintia blocked Zoltán on Facebook and Zoltán in his own words threw Cintia stuff out the window 

 Please no more congratulations Cintia got together with my friend and she out forrás Facebook 

 The story above likely to feature no real people at all. 

 Zoltán Cintia Kiara and Benedek live in an alternative reality where the Liberty Statue of Budapest holds copper flower where the Chain Bridge runs into the Parliament and where young Asian pharmacis can without difficulty become middle aged businessman with Caucasian features from one day to the next 

 The soap-opera-worthy tale in the introduction features characters who belong to Facebook network that numbers nearly one hundred profiles We track the profiles we examined in this table 

 Their virtual personas appear to behave like ordinary people they post about relationships tease friends and share family photos Yet behind these personal stories another purpose becomes clear The same profiles produce and circulate pro-government content on an assembly-line scale 

 They also routinely mock each other forrás Facebook 

 Roughly half of the network we mapped forty-nine users in all also belong to Facebook group called the Warriors Club Harcosok Klubja in Hungarian It public community that according to its own description supports the private Warriors Club launched by Prime Minister Viktor Orbán The supporter group was created in March by Balázs Szakonyi the former Fidesz–KDNP chairman in Tapolca and its posts are writt alternately by him and former Fidesz–KDNP candidate István Pálinkás who ran for mayor in Rácalmás in NUM The group has twenty administrators among them Gábor founder of the conservative news site Vidék hang and Attila Huda who completed the Megafon social media training program in NUM 

 The unofficial Warriors Club has grown to nearly twenty-five thousand followers and alongside the fake accounts its members include Bence Apáti of the National Resistence Movement Member of Parliament Miklós Seszták MEP András László and analysts from the government-aligned Nézőpont Institute 

 Plastic Warriors 

 Cintia who according to her Facebook profile single again was unusually active on the social media site on November NUM Between 6:30 and 10:30 that evening she posted total of twenty-five short videos about the Orbán–Trump meeting in Washington 

 She reported on Orbán visit to the United States almost minute by minute forrás Facebook 

 commenters were not surprised by Cintia political engagemegy Many seemed to share her enthusiasm Under the video in which the Hungarian prime minister spoke about upcoming Hungarian investments in the United States the responses included 

 Come on Hungary Zsombor Erdős 

 Excellent keep going hajrá Ferenc Juhász 

 These are good things Zsolt Debreceni 

 This as it should Zétény Farkas 

 🧡🧡 Sándor Szabó 

 Come on Hungary Zsombor Erdős 

 Exactly Rókus Simka 

 forrás Facebook 

 Despite the late hour and the fact that twenty of Cintia other posts touched on similar themes the same people continued to voice their support under each one Every agreement reached in Washington seemed to please them whether it concerned Hungary gas supply utility costs the peace summi or the two countries nuclear cooperation 

 Their enthusiasm went even further They did not limit their reactions to the videos of the Orbán–Trump meeting on Cintia feed They were active on the pages of other friends as well including Mihály who on November NUM outpaced even Cintia by posting thirty-nine videos on the topic The commenters kept up even when only two minutes separated the posts of their two friends 

 This what supportive circle of friends looks like forrás Facebook 

 The two cases above are only snapshots from more than thousand political posts shared on Facebook over the past two months by members of Fidesz-friendly network organized in early October 

 We uncovered the profiles belonging to this network through snowball method tracing one user public activity to others who commented on liked or shared content posted by accounts we considered suspicious Our initial reference point was three Facebook pages flagged by one of our readers 

 The database ultimately included eighty-seven profiles that met at least three of the following criteria 

 they were created in NUM and began posting publicly only in the pas two months 

 their profile photos and image-based posts were generated with artificial intelligence 

 they show hyperactive behavior posting and commenting on party-political topics in quick succession and in formulaic ways 

 their friends lists include other members of the network and 

 they belong to the supporter group called the Warriors Club 

 Based on these conditions it highly likely that members of the network appear on Facebook under false names use fabricated identities or at least mislead others about their real appearance and lives while they share and comment pro-Fidesz content in coordinated way 

 Zoltán Kiara and Cintia all meet these criteria while the account belonging to the other man in the love triangle Benedek was deleted after we began collecting data kiar first public post dates to October NUM and few days later she had already published doz reels from the pro-government Peace March Under her posts we find other members of the network as well as the former boyfriend of his supposed sister Zoltán whose profile photo was taken from real person and then enhanced with artificial intelligence 

 Kiara's posts on 23rd October forrás Facebook 

 Beyond the Orbán–Trump summi and the Peace March this alternative distribution network also helped amplify other public events important to Fidesz including Orbán speech in the Strasbourg parliament the Digital Civic Circle gathering in Győr and Egon Rónai interview with Viktor Orbán The results were not insignificant Several posts drew between two thousand and forty-five hundred reactions in rapid succession 

 The active members of the network are Mihály László Eliza and Lajos who all appeared with public posts on the platform in mid to late October and immediately joined the Warriors Club During their brief careers they each posted between NUM and NUM times sharing short reels cut from the videos of pro-government content creators The reels are repackaged versions of existing videos highlighting the striking quotes 

 The importance of reels-videos circulating on Facebook was recently emphasized by Magor Dukász Fidesz strategist during the Warriors Club training camp in Zánka Facebook reels have exploded he said adding that the NUM campaign will revolve around them 

 The material used by the fake-profile network spans the entire pro-government media ecosystem from state television broadcasts and live videos by Fidesz politicians to the Patrióta channel run by Megafon on YouTube Even platforms such as Ultrahang program focused on foreign and security policy and Narancskommandó's trashy commentary are part of the mix 

 From top to bottom left to right Hirado.hu Warriors Hour Ultrahang Lázárinfó Magyar Nemzet Dániel Bohár the reporter Government Info Patrióta Orange Commando Hír TV Bayer Show Forrás Facebook 

 Interestingly members of the network do not share the videos from the official pages of the original creators Instead they appear to download the footage reedit it ad captions and publish it under their own profiles When we checked one video from Magyar Nemzet against the version circulated by profiles linked to the network we found that the latter presented the same material in more direct and more strident form 

 Left video clip posted on Magyar Nemzet TikTok page 

 right Lajos Mészáros Facebook page forrás TikTok Facebook 

 well-chosen video clip can travel far beyond the network's own bubble Mihály who has NUM friends on Facebook drew NUM likes NUM shares and NUM comments with his viral post 

 This not the botnet we were waiting for 

 Since Fidesz digital presence gathered new momentum analysts from Zoltán Lakner to Csaba Molnár have raised the possibility that the Warriors Club and the Digital Civic Circles could also serve to mask information operations carried out by bot networks or fake profiles Official estimates suggest that more than NUM people have already joined the two initiatives The Warriors Club now counts nearly NUM members while the Digital Civic Circles list NUM on their website 

 Photos from offline events show that the governing party can present real flesh and blood activists They do fill stadiums so they exis even if they are mostly older Fidesz supporters less familiar with political marketing Yet several analysts who spoke to NUM predicted that the hype surrounding the Warriors Club and the Digital Civic Circles could easily obscure later intervention carried out with automated technology potentially even from abroad 

 Warriors Club training camp II near Lake Balaton Fotó BARANYAI ATTILA/BARANYAI ATTILA 

 By contrast for now we have run into something quite different network of nearly one hundred accounts that sits somewhere between digital work powered by human labor and purely technological solutions The profiles appear to operated by real people though likely not the individuals they present themselves as on Facebook through AI generated simulations 

 Cintia for instance probably not Fidesz activis whose official documents bear the ne Cintia Horváth and who looks exactly like the person shown on her Facebook profile There may well someone who supports Fidesz by posing online as Cintia and possibly at the same time as Zoltán or Kiara in order to comment on like and share pro-government content in their names 

 Because this done in coordinated fashion as part of network of fake accounts that echoes nearly identical messages their activity fits Facebook definition of coordinated inauthentic behavior which the platform prohibits It perhaps no coincidence that some profiles have already been removed 

 Although the profiles cluster in Facebook group that supports the Warriors Club it remains unclear who exactly behind the network The timing of the posts suggests that whoever manages the profiles active during working hours between NUM a.m and NUM p.m 

 These accounts represent an entirely new level of sophistication in their construction their operation and the digital storytelling woven around them 

 Characters built with this degree of precision have been rare in Hungarian public life which means it time to rethink what we learned from the usual how to spot troll primers 

 It no longer matter of scanning profile photos for extra fingers or crooked eyeglass frames and tools like the thispersondoesnotexist generator are already outdated New generation AI systems work at far more advanced level 

 The old rule of thumb that suspicious profiles can exposed by their small number of friends also no longer applies Cintia for example has NUM friends Mihály has NUM followers and across the network the average well above one thousand 

 Nor can we say that these accounts share only occasionally cute animal photo to seem more believable Instead they have lives and identities of their own 

 But what exactly are those To answer that we need to explore the wide circle of friends around Cintia and Zoltán 

 Fradi fishing and no social media Until now 

 Cintia sister Kiara already appeared in the introduction as football devotee She leaves no doubt about her passion In november post she poses in front of Puskás Aréna dressed head to toe in the national tricolor Although several small clues in the image suggest it was generated by artificial intelligence such as the misspelled hajrá magayok text on her shirt some commenters still believed she was real One even wrote that Kiara Real Hungarian Girl which why they accepted her friend request 

 Kiar miniskirt ripples in the colors of the Bulgarian flag but that didn t bother many people forrás Facebook 

 similar method drew Facebook users to many other profiles in the network whose lives also appear to revolve around football cheer for Fradi but there are fans of other Hungarian football teams such as Honvéd Diósgyőr MTK and even foreign ones like Lazio and Liverpool 

 forrás Facebook 

 Although of the profiles use AI generated faces there was at least one case involving Zoltán mentioned in the introduction where photo of real member of B Közép one of Ferencváros best known supporter groups was stolen and later altered with AI. 

 It seems very suspicious to me that some fan group connected to Fradi was used for this because the common point between me and the fake profile that we are both members of such groups 

 the man said after we showed him the fake ultra profile that continues to use his image misleadingly 

 photo of real person remained on Zoltán feed He used it to announce that he was dating Cintia one of the central figures in the fake-profile network forrás Facebook 

 The accounts that rely on football follow the same template Their cover and profile photos already signal the theme through team logos jerseys terraces or stadiums The subject also gives them something consistent to post about Their feeds are filled with football news insider snippets from fan groups and occasional greetings to fellow supporters accompanied by photos that show signs of AI generation 

 The green and whites are in the majority forrás Antal Varga Sándor Gere Petra Lantos Vince Bercsényi oldal Facebook 

 Their friend counts show how effective well chosen them can In Hungary football not only the national sport but in the words of Prime Minister Viktor Orbán part of the Hungarian identity Celebrating goal by the national team together or mourning defeat creates strong emotional bonds and builds sense of community even among strangers 

 Árpád at the Hungary–Ireland match forrás Facebook 

 Once that foundation set the more political material can follow 

 Sándor feed textbook example of this gradual buildup Between October NUM and november NUM he post only football-related content After his seventh post he switched topics and introduced the Győr meeting of the Digital Civic Circles dropping in seventeen reels at once Videos featuring Márton Békés Philipp Rákay Zsófi Szabó and of course Prime Minister Viktor Orbán have since disappeared from his page but we saved them in time It was not the only instance of posts being removed once topic had run its course as the network members routinely deleted such content from their timelines 

 At first only football B Közép mirror selfie M4 Sport news then an overwhelming amount of Fidesz content forrás Facebook 

 Sándor also plays the role of young Fidesz voter on others feeds chiming in with comments like Orbán legend or dad right in style that matches the persona 

 Alongside football the other favorite pastime of these fake profiles fishing 

 They also eat and drink go to work walk their dogs pick mushrooms hike in the Bükk hills fall in love raise children prepare for Halloween dive drive cook take vacations build models work in the garden play video games go shopping and fly abroad In other words they behave exactly like real people 

 It's my li From top to bottom and left to right photos from the Facebook pages of Hanna Barta Péter Lovas János Barna Aladár Harczos Tamara Horváth János Barna Mihály Török Tamara Horváth Tamara Horváth Zsolt Debreczeni Antal Varga Attila Balogh Szilveszter Sagy Géza Németh Izabella Fülöp Regő Józsa Máté Bolla Mariann Szabó Sándor Szabó and Aladár Harczos forrás Facebook 

 Anyone else joined in NUM 

 While the operators of the profiles try to make their activity look authentic one thing hard to hide with photos and links how long someone has been on the platform 

 Almost every Facebook profile in the network we uncovered was created in NUM with the first public posts appearing this October between the Peace March and Orbán visit to Washington 

 We confirmed this with simple trick profile registration date can checked by searching the user unique ID number which appears after the equals sign in the Facebook URL on Facebook Marketplace 

 Forrás Facebook 

 Although only the year of joining visible there anyone looking for more precise date should scroll back to the very first public posts on profile 

 For Rókus that date October NUM when he uploaded cover photo of the Tihany Peninsula He offered no explanation for why he began posting on the platform only now more than fifteen years after Facebook became available in Hungary By contrast we found dozens of profiles in the network whose creators felt the need to clarify this point 

 Some claimed that their previous profile had been 

 hacked 

 blocked 

 or that they had simply lost access to it 

 The creative explanation was the claim that someone had locked themselves out of their own account 

 Forrás Facebook 

 Others noted in their introductions that they had never been on social media before 

 Recently g an FB page but only because I love fishing and it looks like there are lots of anglers her wrote Patrik who appears to live with his family in Szigetszentmiklós though he surfaced in our network because of his repetitive comments 

 Tibor younger fishing and football fanatic post this 

 Fradi fishing and no social media Until now I would tweak that last part bit 

 Digital detox may trendy in NUM but the Google AI assistant logo in the lower right corner of his photo casts this excuse in different light The star-shaped watermark of Google Gemini oft hidden by Facebook circular profile frame so it worth clicking through to view photos at full size 

 The beginning of beautiful friendship 

 Since Facebook suspended paid political advertising in Europe citing the EU's new transparency rules personal networks have once again grown in importance Through them political content can reach users who would not necessarily seek it out on their own 

 This why it crucial for an inauthentic network to have its members actively build connections with real users if only fake profiles interact with one another the impact negligible 

 I have seen this method work in my own circles Several suspicious profiles managed to draw in not only my friends but even one of my colleagues 

 András from Baja It would have been easier to download cityscape because this way several things are off forrás Facebook 

 Zsuzsi contacted András because of the October NUM protest organized by students at the Budapest Business University BGE The event was posted by an anonymous Facebook page called Free BGE but for long time it was unclear who was behind it Since the page editors didn t respond I wrote to few people who appeared among the page friends including András Zsuzsi sai I wanted to follow the events so I reached out He accepted my request quickly and saw my message which has since disappeared I don t really understand why 

 On October NUM András profile shifted into professional mode and the content of his posts changed completely While he had previously shared memes about university life on november NUM he posted thirty one reels from the Győr Digital Civic Circles meeting in single day roughly one every minute 

 He shared posts from other fake profiles with his own commentary but he also posted OCs original content forrás Facebook 

 It hard to determine whether András account once belonged to BGE student and was taken during the shift to professional mode or whether it was fake profile from the start whose operators capitalized on the momentum of the campus protest to gain new friends 

 Switching to professional mode in itself does not threaten the integrity or security of profile The feature allows users to build public presence from personal account and in some cases even earn money from their content at that point the profile functions in some ways like Facebook Page anyone can follow the posts without being friend 

 It important to note however that any new feature including professional mode can create opportunities for bad actors to send scam messages in Facebook ne These oft look like official notices and are designed to extract personal information or gain access to the account 

 In analyzing the network we also encountered less harmful but still deceptive and manipulative methods of friend gathering 

 The profiles of the platinum blonde Tamara Vanessza and Fanni are not only attractive but deploy sexual appeal for effect oft posting so-called thirst traps And it not just the women Another acquaintance of mine accepted request from tall dark haired profile named Bertalan because as he put it there are trees and puppies on his profile and those are my weaknesses 

 Left to right top Tamara Horváth Fanni Mira Tamara Horváth bottom Fanni Szabó Cintia Horváth Emma Kertész 

 Forrás Facebook 

 We will not speculate on whether pro-Fidesz content goes down more easily when mixed with soft erotica What clear that on November NUM Tamara boosted the visibility of Orbán visit to Washington with thirteen videos while actively commenting much like Bertalan 

 forrás Facebook 

 Another friend of mine was pulled in by member of the network through shared connections He probably knew it would easier to get accepted if he started adding people within specific circle that why I accepted his connection request too We had nearly hundred mutual friends in literature and I usually assume that means someone an aspiring writer because many reach out that way Out of simple courtesy I tend to accept those requests my friend said He has since cut ties with Vincze 

 We found the boldest case of friend fishing in Facebook dating group These groups have recently flooded the platform and the algorithm now recommends their content even to users who never joined them In one such open group with NUM followers Zoltán not the one presented in the introduction who threw Cintia's stuff out of the window but another Zoltán posted the likely AI-generated photo below which drew NUM likes and nearly NUM comments accompanied by the invitation Add me and we ll talk 

 Zoltán authenticity further undermined by the fact that he previously used profile picture now displayed by another member of the network Béla 

 Within the network Zoltán profile used mainly to post comments that boost the spread of pro-government content 

 He everywhere forrás Facebook 

 rapidly changing world 

 Zoltán did not have any fishing gear at hand y he somehow reel in mirror carp from the rippling Danube We could have glossed over this inconsistency by assuming the fishing rod was left out of the frame It much harder to explain how someone can businessman with Caucasian features one day young pharmacis with slightly Asian features two days later and then something entirely different again few days after that 

 Péter on the 1st 4th and 10th day of his Facebook life forrás Facebook 

 This character building glitch that occasionally breaks the otherwise coherent storytelling of these personas In some cases though profile changes simply because it rewired Ágoston for instance began his online career as historian but the history program at ELTE may have seemed less than enticing so he switched to fishing He now has thousand followers 

 Frissül forrás Facebook 

 few days ago this what greet visitors on his page but by the time we wrote this article the political content had disappeared 

 Ágoston case shows how quickly we adapt to visual style linked to artificial intelligence only for new one to emerge or replace it 

 The profile photos in the network described in this article are no longer produced with the technology that became known around NUM through ThisPersonDoesNotExist.com that site relied on Nvidia open source StyleGAN and demonstrated how generative model could create unlimited numbers of realistic yet entirely fabricated faces few years later the technology filtered into Hungarian public life as well two years ago we reported on how profiles generated with ThisPersonDoesNotExist.com were used to support an opposition candidate in Újpest But that program could produce only ID style standard sized front facing portraits and over time the patterns in the faces it generated became easy to spot 

 Starts from the left pupil forrás This Person Doesn't Exis 

 With the new generation of artificial intelligence systems such as Midjourney ChatGPT Grok and Google Gemini there no point looking for mismatched earrings crooked eyeglass temples or pupils converging on single spot With text prompts or visual examples almost any image can now produced and real photos can refined as well These tools generate not only faces but full scenes with detailed backgrounds 

 Ágoston régi bal profilkép jobb oldal forrás Facebook 

 According to Google the image on the left created for Ágoston profile was generated by its own AI assistant Gemini What gives away its artificial origin not flaws but the opposite an excess of perfection that makes it look as if it were taken in professional studio 

 The story of the second image more complicated After we ran it through facial recognition tool we located the original photo taken four years earlier of man who teaches sport fishing on Lake Geneva 

 Top the original image bottom the version modified with AI. Forrás Ágoston Ferencz Facebook 

 It likely that the AI image generator did not create an entirely new portrait of fisherman but used an existing photo as its base and modified it giving the subject longer brown hair for example to fit Ágoston invented persona 

 Although this profile picture would difficult to identify as artificial at first glance small errors can still reveal picture's origin and offer clues for spotting AI generated images These flaws or oddities oft appear in the background especially in built environments or in text placed on signs 

 Emma who according to her profile works at government office and already has thousand Facebook friends posted photo on October NUM in which she stands on the Pest embankment looking across the Danube The view striking and commenters were fascinated but because she facing away from the camera almost no one noticed the mistake in reality instead of the Liberty Bridge the Chain Bridge runs toward the base of Buda Castle 

 Impossible panorama forrás Facebook 

 AI struggled with the Hungarian Parliament building as well In Lili profile photo not only do the details of the neo-Gothic structure differ from Imre Steindl original design the program also hallucinated three figure statue group in the middle of the square and failed to spell the country ne correctly on the banner held by the demonstrators 

 Hungary fist forrás Facebook 

 The striking error appears in Kiara profile picture The image compresses three Budapest landmarks the Parliament the Chain Bridge and the Liberty Statue into single vantage point even though they can never seen together this way in reality The details are also wrong The Chain Bridge practically runs into the Parliament and the female figure atop the Citadella holds not flower but the palm branch that symbolizes victory and peace 

 3:1 forrás Facebook 

 Botched cityscapes oft draw attention to themselves through the figures placed in them who typically stand with their backs to the camera The composition serves not only an aesthetic purpose but practical one It harder to spot flaws when the face hidden 

 Caspar David Friedrich epigones in the Fidesz universe forrás Facebook 

 While we were reporting this story numerous accounts replaced their profile or cover photos with real or imagined national symbols Alongside the Parliament the crown the scepter and the national flag there were oddities her as well 

 We were not previously familiar with coat of arms that combines the Amazon logo with an eagle drawing bow forrás Facebook 

 The Parliament draped in Matyó embroidery How foreigners imagine Hungary forrás Facebook 

 The renovation of the Chain Bridge turned out well kiar likes it too forrás Facebook 

 Cover image Bence Kiss/444

Fidesz's voter base deeply divided over government's handling of abuse in juvenile detention cent poll shows More than half of the Hungarian electorate strongly critical of the government's response to what has become known as the Szőlő street affair and even when it comes to its own voter base Fidesz can only count on the support of small segment in this matter according to the results of public opinion poll commissioned by Telex The representative survey conducted by the NUM Research Center focused on finding out who Hungarians believe responsible for the events at Szőlő street and how they view the government's communication on this issue 

 In recen months Szőlő street affair has become the umbrella term used to describe the series of abuse allegations that have come to light regarding the events at juvenile detention facility in Budapest Szőlő street In May police arrested the former director of the institution and his partner under suspicion of human trafficking forced labor and also charged the man with multiple counts of abuse of public office and the misuse of firearm Since then six more suspects have been questioned in the investigation total of six former employees of the institution are in custody one under criminal supervision and the arrest of another one has been requested They are charged with various things with several of them accused of having abused the minors held at the facility 

 quarter of those surveyed said they primarily blame the government for the abuse cases at Szőlő Street NUM percent blame the institution's employees NUM percent blame the director and NUM percent believe the minors living there are responsible How politicised the case has become also evident from the extent to which the respondents party affiliation determines their views on the question of responsibility 

 While the majority of those who support the ruling party hold the institution's employees responsible Tisza voters consider the government to primarily responsible 

 Twenty-eight percent of Fidesz voters blame the juvenile detention center's employees while only half as many say the director responsible More than half of Tisza's voters NUM percen say the government ultimately responsible 

 Among voters who support smaller parties the proportion of those who believe that the government primarily responsible for the whole affair NUM percen and those who blame the director NUM percen roughly the same unaffiliated voters had not heard about the case or were unable to answer the question of those who are unaffiliated but had heard about the case hold the staff of the institution as primarily responsible 

 On scale of one to five where one very poor and five very good NUM percent of respondents rated the government's response as very poor An additional NUM percen rated it as poor meaning that total of NUM percen are dissatisfied with the government's handling of the situation Only NUM percen considered it good or very good 

 It therefore eviden that on this issue the government can only count on the support of smaller segment of its own voter base while 

 more than half of the entire electorate explicitly critical of the ruling party's response making this an extremely damaging issue for Fidesz 

 Even pro-government voters are divided on the subject with NUM percent rating Fidesz's response as bad with only NUM percen satisfied with it This an unusually low percentage among the traditionally staunch pro-government voter base 

 It very rare for the vast majority of Fidesz supporters not to line up behind measure simply because the word government appears in the question And outside the Fidesz camp there are hardly any satisfied respondents Among Tisza supporters there were none at all while among the voters for other parties NUM percen held this opinion and among those without party affiliation only NUM percen did 

 Methodology The hybrid data collection took place between December NUM and NUM NUM with sample size of NUM respondents Respondents received link to the online questionnaire via text message The political preferences of respondents over the age of NUM were surveyed by telephone The NUM Research Center used the same method for its EP election poll and for its previous research mentioned in the article The entire sample was weighted according to the NUM census data of the Hungarian Central Statistical Office KSH for place of residence gender age and educational background The sample representative of the entire population with the values obtained in the sample deviating by +/- NUM percentage points from what would have been obtained if the entire population had been surveyed However when examining sub-populations the margin of error may slightly higher

 Korosztály generáció 

 NUM század markáns generációs elmélet Mannheim dolgoz lényeg korosztály közel azonos időszak született ember összesség szerveződik generáció értelmezés társadalmi csoport megváltoztathat történelem irányát[2]. Karl Mannheim tézis nyomán kibővítve árnyalva korábbi munka maga korosztály generáció formálódás három feltétel tételez egyrészt korosztály tag érzékeny kor gyermek kamaszkori eszmélődés időszak kollektív élmény markáns cezúraszerű társadalmi történés élhet másrészt szülő elleni kamaszkori lázadás világnézeti forma ölt végül korosztály tag közös ellenségképe[3]. 

 Mannheim nyomán további feltétel korosztály megszűl méh un reprezentatív csoport reprezentatív csoport fő jellemző tudattalan képes hang ad korosztály életérzés nyilvánosság tesz tehet
